Package ir.ceno.controller

Class PostController

  • java.lang.Object
    • ir.ceno.controller.PostController

  • @Controller
@RequestMapping("/posts")
public class PostController
extends java.lang.Object
    Controller that deals with post-related operations.

    Requests to urls starting with /posts are dispatched here.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PostController​(PostService postService, SearchService searchService)

    • Method Detail

      • showNewPostPage

        @GetMapping("/new")
public java.lang.String showNewPostPage​(@RequestHeader("referer")
                                        java.lang.String referer,
                                        org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                        org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttrs)
        Shows the new post page if request is from an authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        referer - the referer header of the request
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
        redirectAttrs - model to add prompt if the user is not authenticated
        Returns:
        view name of the new post page

      • submitNewPost

        @PostMapping("/submit")
public java.lang.String submitNewPost​(@RequestParam
                                      java.lang.String title,
                                      @RequestParam
                                      java.lang.String summary,
                                      @RequestParam
                                      java.lang.String article,
                                      @RequestParam
                                      java.lang.String category,
                                      @RequestParam
                                      org.springframework.web.multipart.MultipartFile file,
                                      org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                      org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttrs)
        Adds new post to the site.
        Parameters:
        title - the title of the post
        summary - the summary of the post
        article - the main article of the post
        category - comma-separated categories of the post
        file - the image or video of the post
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
        redirectAttrs - model to add prompt whether post created successfully or not
        Returns:
        redirect to the home page

      • like

        @PostMapping("/like")
@ResponseBody
public void like​(@RequestParam
                 long postId,
                 @RequestParam
                 java.lang.Boolean like,
                 org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
        Likes or dislikes the specified post.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to be liked/disliked
        like - true if it's like, false if dislike
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated

      • getFile

        @GetMapping({"/images/{postId}","/videos/{postId}"})
@ResponseBody
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<byte[]> getFile​(@PathVariable
                                                               long postId)
        Returns the file (image or video) of the specified post.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to get its file
        Returns:
        ResponseEntity containing the file bytes
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the post does not exist

      • showPost

        @GetMapping("/{postUrl}")
public java.lang.String showPost​(@PathVariable
                                 java.lang.String postUrl,
                                 org.springframework.ui.Model model)
        Gets the post by its url and adds it to the model.
        Parameters:
        postUrl - url of the post
        model - the model to add attributes to
        Returns:
        view name of the post page
        Throws:
        ResourceNotFoundException - if the post does not exist

      • pinPost

        @PostMapping("/pin")
public java.lang.String pinPost​(@RequestParam
                                long postId,
                                @RequestHeader("referer")
                                java.lang.String referer,
                                org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttrs)
        Pins the specified post to the homepage of the site.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to pin
        referer - the referer header of the request
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
        redirectAttrs - model to add prompt whether post pinned or unpinned
        Returns:
        redirect to the referer page

      • deletePost

        @PostMapping("/delete")
public java.lang.String deletePost​(@RequestParam
                                   long postId,
                                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                   org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttrs)
        Deletes the specified post from the site.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to be deleted
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
        redirectAttrs - model to add prompt if post deleted successfully
        Returns:
        redirect to the home page

      • reportPost

        @PostMapping("/report")
public java.lang.String reportPost​(@RequestParam
                                   long postId,
                                   @RequestHeader("referer")
                                   java.lang.String referer,
                                   org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication,
                                   org.springframework.web.servlet.mvc.support.RedirectAttributes redirectAttrs)
        Sets the reported flag of the specified post to true.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to set its reported flag
        referer - the referer header of the request
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
        redirectAttrs - model to add prompt if post was reported successfully
        Returns:
        redirect to the referer page

      • addComment

        @PostMapping("/comments/add")
@ResponseBody
public void addComment​(@RequestParam
                       long postId,
                       @RequestParam
                       java.lang.String comment,
                       org.springframework.security.core.Authentication authentication)
        Adds comment to the specified post.
        Parameters:
        postId - id of the post to add comment to
        comment - the comment of the user
        authentication - security authentication to check if the user is authenticated
